title: U.S. Probes Titanium Imports in Possible Tariff Case
summary: Commerce Department to investigate potential national-security risks at the request of a domestic producer. The Trump administration said Monday it will investigate the possible national-security risks of imports of titanium, the metal used in aircraft and other products, in a case that could end in tariffs or other trade barriers.

title: Democrats Aim to Block Trump Administration Move on Abortion Providers
summary: Oregon, 21 state attorneys general plan to sue over plan to strip Planned Parenthood, others of millions of dollars for family planning under Title X. WASHINGTON-Democratic-led states are going to court to block a Trump administration plan to strip on-site abortion providers such as Planned Parenthood Federation of America of millions of taxpayer dollars for family planning, arguing the federal government is exceeding its authority to limit the federal funding.

title: Regulators Target Energy-Efficient Home Improvements Loans
summary: Critics caution such loans could bring another debt crisis. WASHINGTON-Federal regulators are preparing to clamp down on a popular loan program used to finance solar panels and other energy-saving home improvements.

title: Cheniere Deal With China Signals Country's Key Role in LNG Exports
summary: Long-term contract is expected to be unveiled as part of U.S.-China trade deal. Cheniere Energy Inc.'s expected $18 billion deal to supply natural gas to China signals the company's growing bet on the country, and China's emergence as a top market for U.S. gas exporters.

title: Senate Will Block Trump's Border-Wall Plan, McConnell Says
summary: Chamber has enough votes to disapprove president's plan, Senate majority leader says, likely forcing veto. WASHINGTON-Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R., Ky.) said a resolution seeking to block President Trump from declaring a national emergency would pass the GOP-controlled Senate, likely forcing the president to issue his first veto in a bid to secure the funding he wants for a border wall.

title: AI Efforts at Large Companies May Be Hindered by Poor Quality Data
summary: Executives surveyed by PwC said cleaning up their data would lead to big cost savings and revenue gains. summary: Maria Teresa Tejada is the latest external hire to join the risk division of the battled bank. summary: Committee seeks information on Russia, hush-money payments, Comey firing. The document requests issued Monday by the House Judiciary Committee cover a broad range of issues, as part of investigations the committee is starting into obstruction of justice, corruption and abuse of power.

title: Hickenlooper Up the Middle
summary: The Coloradan won't ban fossil fuels. Can he persuade Democrats?. summary: Liberals play the race card against a Korean-American immigrant.. summary: The president has left his negotiators better positioned for a good deal with Pyongyang.. Hanoi

title: Allies Worry Over U.S. Public Opinion
summary: The gap between voters and foreign-policy elites shows little sign of closing.. There is no more important question in world politics than this: Will U.S. public opinion continue to support an active and strategically focused foreign policy? During the Cold War and for 25 years after, there was rarely any doubt. While Americans argued-sometimes bitterly-over the country's overseas priorities, there was a broad consensus in both parties that sustained engagement was necessary to protect U.S. interests.

title: 'Old' the Phone, Another Scammer Is Calling
summary: As soon as I turned 70, offers rolled in for wheelchairs, cruises and cremation plans.. In T. S. Eliot's "Little Gidding" there is a sarcastic line: "Let me disclose the gifts reserved for old age." The "gifts" Eliot mentions include "the cold friction of expiring sense" and "the rending pain of re-enactment / Of all that you have done, and been." Eliot died before the advent of modern computer technology, so he did not experience another "gift" of old age: constant phone calls from mostly illegitimate businesses trying to sell you something.

title: Salesforce: Gravity Still Applies
summary: Cloud software giant's strong growth outlook still implies some slowdown. Salesforce.com showed two things with its latest quarterly report Monday afternoon: The cloud software giant can still put up some big numbers and "deceleration" remains the most dreaded word in the tech lexicon.

title: 'Spies of No Country' Review: The Dawn of Mossad
summary: Agents were taught rudimentary spycraft on a kibbutz, then sent off to gather intelligence and occasionally to blow something up.. title: Tax Reform Unleashed the U.S. Economy
summary: The surge in private investment has brought big returns for households as well as the government.. For a midterm report card on the economy under President Trump, take a look at two recent government reports. The Commerce Department reported Thursday that real gross domestic product grew by 3.1% from the fourth quarter of 2017 to the fourth quarter of 2018-the largest rise in 13 years. And last month the Congressional Budget Office reported that even if the current surge in economic growth isn't sustained, the revenue residual from our current strong growth rate will pay for some 80% of the projected cost of the 2017 tax reform. While these reports reflect only the initial impact of the tax cuts and the deregulatory effort, any objective evaluation would give the administration's economic program high midterm marks.

title: Behind China's Desire for a Trade Deal With Trump
summary: President Xi's nationalism is running into the reality of slower growth and a fear of political instability.. Xi Jinping came into office in 2012 with guns drawn. He needed to tame the Communist Party and enthrall the Chinese people. He achieved the first, to great applause, by bringing down corrupt party powerhouses such as Bo Xilai and Zhou Yongkang. He defined his China Dream as the "Great Rejuvenation of the Chinese People," playing to the historical humiliation by foreign occupiers drummed into every Chinese schoolchild: the Opium Wars, foreign spheres of influence, Japanese occupation. Finally, China had shucked off its albatross. Even party skeptics bought into his hypernationalism.

title: What Your Doctor Isn't Allowed to Tell You
summary: Badly designed electronic records can be hazardous to your health, but a gag clause protects the makers.. But he was ruffled when he told the story of giving a patient anesthesia and performing a medically unnecessary procedure-only he hadn't known it was unnecessary because the patient's electronic health record, or EHR, didn't function as promised.

title: Jordan Peele Is the New Master of Suspense
summary: In his highly anticipated film 'Us,' the director again uses horror to investigate the soul of contemporary America. On a narrow street in the hills above Los Angeles, tourists cluster together with their smartphones held high: The Hollywood sign looms behind them, and they're taking selfies. If they paid any attention to the house directly in front of them, they might spot the cameras installed around the facade, or the guard on hand to ward off intruders. These precautions are in place not because of who lives inside but what: Within a temperature-controlled box on the topmost floor, one of 2019's most-anticipated films sits on a server connected to editing consoles throughout the house. The movie is Us, comedian-turned-horror auteur Jordan Peele's follow-up to his 2017 smash, Get Out-a deeply disturbing, wildly entertaining exploration of covert American racism that earned Peele an Oscar for screenwriting and a nomination for best director, and which grossed a quarter of a billion dollars worldwide on a budget of just $4.5 million.

John Hickenlooper said Monday that he will seek the Democratic nomination for president in 2020, becoming the first member of the crowded field to run by trumpeting a record of working with Republicans.

title: Westmoreland Announces Approval of Chapter 11 Plan
summary: Resume Subscription. Westmoreland Coal Co. announced Monday that a bankruptcy court has approved the sale of its assets under its chapter 11 plan.

title: Trump's China Deal Could Punish U.S. Allies
summary: America first in a U.S.-China trade pact could deal a serious blow to the economies of friends around the world. Beijing and President Trump appear near to a trade deal: China buys a lot more U.S. stuff, gives some ground on auto-industry protections and intellectual property, and mostly ignores other U.S. complaints.

title: Lyft's IPO Has a Winner in Japan Already
summary: Rakuten, Japan's answer to Amazon, deserves a closer look from investors, thanks to its 13% stake in Lyft. Lyft Inc. has finally unveiled its long-awaited initial public offering. The biggest beneficiary lies across the Pacific.

title: Shopping at Discount Stores Could Help Get You a Loan
summary: Discover plans to use artificial intelligence to assess personal-loan applicants as it tries to rein in losses. Discount-store shoppers may soon get an unexpected benefit: better odds when applying for personal loans from Discover Financial Services .

title: Derby's Take: Former Fed No. 2 Lauds Powell's Defense of Mandate
summary: Resume Subscription. The former second-in-command at the Federal Reserve had nothing but kind words for current leader Jerome Powell, and praised his excellent leadership in his first year of service.

title: At Least 23 Killed After Tornadoes Hit Southeast
summary: Storms swept through swaths of Alabama and Georgia; the most destruction appears to be in Lee County, Ala.. At least 23 people were killed by tornadoes that swept through swaths of Alabama and Georgia on Sunday, according to officials.

title: Senior Goldman Banker in Asia to Join KKR
summary: Kate Richdale will join KKR in a newly created role of head of strategy and business development in Asia. Kate Richdale, a senior investment banker at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. in Asia, is leaving to join KKR & Co., the U.S. private-equity giant said Monday.

title: Taboola Makes Acquisition to Bolster Its Take on Apple News
summary: Deal will put Taboola recommendations on more Android phones' lock screens. Taboola Inc., the "content recommendation" engine best known for placing sponsored links on publishers' websites to other content across the web, is acquiring an Israeli team to bolster its young news recommendation service for users of Android phones.

title: REITs Take On New Shine Amid Fed's Softened View on Rates
summary: Investors scoop up REIT shares because of their large dividends, strong earnings growth. The Federal Reserve's dovish tilt this year has been a boon for real-estate shares that were pressured by a threat of higher interest rates.

title: The 6 Biggest Questions About '529' Plans
summary: These college-savings vehicles are extremely popular. But the rules can be confusing.. Four years ago, we started answering readers' questions on saving and paying for higher education, especially about how best to use tax-advantaged "529" accounts.

title: U.S.-Stock Funds Rose 3.7% in February
summary: Investors calmed down about Fed intentions and global-trade disputes. It has been two months of "happy new year" for U.S.-stock fund investors.

title: Why Dividend Stocks Are Popular Again
summary: This volatile stock market is showing the wisdom of owning dividend stocks and dividend-focused funds. Dividend stocks are looking more attractive than they have in a while.

title: Investors Brace for Brexit (and Not Just in the U.K.)
summary: It's time to 'control the controllable' as the U.K. debates leaving the European Union.

title: Where Active Management Still Dominates
summary: Actively managed funds that invest in these countries often beat competing passive funds, research suggests. For fans of active management, the world offers a few ports in the storm.

title: British Stock Investors Go 'on Strike' Ahead of Brexit
summary: The amount of money flowing into U.K. investment funds plunged more than 85% last year as nervous British investors held on to cash. Individual investors in the U.K. soured on fund investments in a big way in 2018, and analysts say nervousness over Brexit was mostly to blame.

title: How Well Do You Understand Market Indexes? Let's Find Out
summary: The popularity of passive investing has resulted in an explosion of securities indexes. How much do you really know about them?. The investing world is awash in indexes.

title: Some Currency ETFs for Brexit Bets
summary: Individual investors in the U.S. can place their wagers on the pound using exchange-traded funds. What will happen on March 29, and how will the pound react?

title: An Idea to Improve 'Target' Funds
summary: The popular retirement-plan funds could do even better if they adjusted automatically for stock-market risk, a new study says. Target-date funds are popular with retirement savers. But a London Business School finance professor says these funds could produce better results if in addition to automatically adjusting stockholdings based on an investor's age, they rebalanced quarterly to account for stock-market risk.

title: Commodities Outlook Remains Rocky
summary: Funds focused on commodities took a beating at the end of 2018, and analysts are skeptical that a rally this year will continue. Commodities-focused funds took a beating in the last three months of 2018 as worries over a slowing economy sent prices for energy and materials plunging.

title: In a Down Market, ETFs Could Make Things Even Worse
summary: New research suggests that the proliferation of exchange-traded funds could create problems in a volatile market. There's a potential problem lurking in the financial markets, and it is partly a result of exchange-traded funds.

title: What Students Can Do if Parents Can't-or Won't-Fill Out College-Aid Forms
summary: Students who don't qualify as independent can appeal, under extenuating circumstances. Generally, college students have a better shot at financial aid when their parents participate in the application process. But parents aren't always willing or able to fulfill this need.

title: An ETF Hopes You Buy That Dress From the U.K. Online
summary: A fund tied to the international online-retailing market was launched at the end of January. A new fund provides U.S. investors with exposure to the rapidly growing international online-retailing market.

title: A Revamped Junk-Bond Fund Welcomes Volatility
summary: MetWest High Yield Bond Fund says it aggressively added to its positions during the high-yield-bond rout in late 2018. After a suffering their biggest loss in three years at the end of 2018, high-yield bonds are rallying again.

title: What Is Implied Earnings Growth?
summary: This metric reveals the market's expectations for how fast or slow a company's earnings will grow and can be used by investors to identify under- and overvalued firms. Investors may start hearing more about "implied earnings growth." It is a metric that can help people make investment decisions, and it is especially relevant during times of market tumult when stocks frequently get mispriced.

title: Venezuela Opposition Leader Juan Guaidó Plans Return
summary: Re-entry on Monday will test President Nicolás Maduro's authority. BOGOTÁ, Colombia-Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaidó said he plans to return to his home country on Monday in a high-stakes strategy that directly challenges President Nicolás Maduro's authority and could end with Mr. Guaidó in jail.

title: Grocers Brace for Another Blow From Amazon
summary: E-commerce giant already has pushed grocers to focus on delivery and pricing. Now it takes aim at stores' profitable beauty aisle. Amazon.com Inc. has challenged grocers by pushing them to lower prices and expand their delivery options. Now the company's latest plans threaten to steal sales of some of the industry's more profitable products.

title: Getting Into the 800 Credit Score Club Is Tough-Staying in Is Tougher
summary: High marks are a status symbol for overachievers who can't stomach less than stellar grades; Cinco the cat's surgery bill. McCathern Painter's heart sank when she learned her cat, Cinco, needed emergency surgery.

title: Vale Executives Step Aside After Pressure in Dam Case
summary: Brazilian investigators are looking into the collapse of a company dam, the deadliest such disaster in more than 50 years. SÃO PAULO- Vale SA Chief Executive Fabio Schvartsman and other top executives of the Brazilian mining giant stepped down following pressure from authorities in the first sign investigators are zeroing in on the company's leadership after the deadly collapse of one of its dams.

title: After Blue Wave, New York GOP Chairman Vies to Retain His Seat
summary: Ed Cox is trying to make the case for a sixth two-year term, but he's got competition. New York Republicans suffered significant losses in the 2018 elections, but longtime state GOP Chairman Ed Cox is pushing ahead for another term.
